result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael Angel Torres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA Sample.
Pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. 
Court WAIVED MANDATORY and NON MANDATORY (except for DNA surcharge) court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to Case Number 22CF1620, BUT consecutive to Case Numbers 20CF375,20CF1727,20CF1365 AND any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Angel Torres

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 48 MONTHS, concurrent to Case Number 22CF1620, BUT consecutive to Case Numbers  20CF375, 20CF1727, 20CF1365 AND any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 24 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. 



CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION

-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens. No controlled substance without a valid precription. 
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with: 
    Oscars Pub, 1712 W Pierce Street, Milwaukee, WI;
    Mr. Taco, 831 S Cesar Chavez Drive, Milwaukee, WI;
    Restaurant Y Taqueria, 2028 W Mitchell Street, Milwaukee, WI;
    El Flamboyan Bakery, 2132 S Muskego Ave., Milwaukee, WI;
    Panaderia El Sol de Mexico, 1716 S. Muskego Ave., Milwaukee, WI;
    Don Lucho, 565 W Lincoln Ave, Milwaukee, WI;
    Lincoln Food and Liquor, 2717 W Lincoln Ave, Milwaukee, WI;
    Rincon de la Salud, 3741 W Greenfield Ave, Milwaukee, WI;
    Asian International Market, 3741 W Greenfield Ave, Milwaukee, WI.
    Chubby Cheesesteak
    One Stop West Allis Food and Liquor
    V.O.B.
    Golden Chicken, 3032 S. 13th St. 
    Villa Restaurant, 2520 W. Greenfield Ave. 
    The Family Grocery Store, 5160 W Forest Home.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling/treatment or combination of all.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. 
-Court WAIVED MANDATORY and NON MANDATORY (except for DNA surcharge) court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant Rafael Angel Torres in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Rafael Angel Torres in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Due to court congestion, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in branch 21.
Received and Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire and Addendum
Received and Filed, Plea Form and Addendum
Received and Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed, Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed, Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Rafael Angel Torres not in court, in custody.  Patrick J. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per counsel, global resolutions have been reached and defense is requesting the court authorize transfer of this matter to Br 21.  The Court authorized transfer.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with B.O.B.
Golden Chicken, 3032 S. 13th St., City and County of Milwaukee
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rafael Angel Torres in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Rafael Angel Torres in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafael Angel Torres appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
